meanings.definition: Coanchors: plural noun - individuals who share the role of anchoring a television or radio program together
meanings.sent1: The coanchors on the morning show greeted the viewers with smiles.
meanings.sent2: The coanchors delivered the news with professionalism and teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The coanchors joked about mixing up their scripts, causing a hilarious on-air moment.
meanings.sent4: The coanchors are like a well-oiled machine, seamlessly guiding the show.
meanings.sent5: The coanchors' chemistry on screen makes the audience feel at ease.

meanings.definition: Coanchors: verb - to work together as anchors on a television or radio program
meanings.sent1: They coanchors the evening news program with grace and precision.
meanings.sent2: We coanchors the sports segment every Friday night.
meanings.sent3: She coanchors the weather report, adding a touch of humor to the forecast.
meanings.sent4: Coanchoring the show, they steer the conversation smoothly between segments.
meanings.sent5: The team coanchors the radio show, ensuring a seamless broadcast.
